Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: jimpete
Reviews.Content: I will stay here again. Good room, great shower, excellent price. Bed was a bit soft for me and it had really helped that we had looked on google streetview at the front of the building. The bus stopped about 20 meters away and it is surrounded by good places to eat. If you want coffee and pastry for breakfast try Baylon cafe, via di S.Francesco, 5 mins walk away. A lovely atmosphere great coffess and fresh pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms, extremely friendly and helpful staff, ...excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Lcorr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sonnino Suite with my partner at the end of February 2012. Having done alot of research into accomodation in the city, I could not have been happier with my choice, which added to our wonderful experience in this beautiful city! We received excellent directions to the door of the hotel, which is ideally located close to the beautiful cafes and restaurants in Trastevere, and is also a short walk to any of the major tourist spots. We stayed in a beautiful, character-filled room which was very spacious and clean. And all for a great price! I would happily recommend the Sonnino Suite to anyone travelling to Bellamy Roma and I look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, convenient, clean, no frills”
Reviews.Author: NooYawkuh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sonnino Suites in December 2011. The value for the price I paid (55 euros/night) was excellent. I stayed in a room that was cleaned daily, with a comfortable bed, and a decent shower in an adorable neighborhood slightly outside the center of Rome. Keep in mind that this is seriously a "no frills" type of place -- the desk is only staffed for a few hours each day, there is no other onsite staff, and nobody ever answered the listed phone number when I called. But if you're looking for good value and don't need a doorman/concierge, this is an excellent choice. The hotel is conveniently located in the Trastevere neighborhood, which has many streets to explore with cute cafes. It's also across a bridge from the old Jewish Ghetto. Largo Argentina, with plenty of bus connections, is about 5-8 minutes walking distance. The Vatican and the Forum are about 20-25 minutes walking distance. There is no metro line nearby. The hallway had free Rome street maps available for those who like walking. Cyrus, one of the hotel's staff, was very friendly in person and via email (as stated above, I could never reach anybody via the phone number, but Cyrus always responded to emails). Although the staff is only onsite for a few hours per day, Cyrus went out of his way to be sure that I could leave my luggage at the hotel for pickup before my late evening flight. (The staff keeps track of guests' flight/train arrival information and they leave after all check-ins are complete.) For the price, my room was large, with plenty of storage, and warm enough (in winter) that I needed to turn down the heat. The beds were comfortable. Towels were not incredibly soft, but I think that's a minor detail. The room had a shower (no bathtub) that was two steps up from the bedroom. The room was cleaned every day. (I think that I may have been quietly upgraded to a larger room than what I paid for, but I'm not sure.) Although it is listed here as a B&B, I was not offered breakfast, and in fact the reservation form specifically stated that breakfast was not included. For the price (and the fact that there are actual bakeries around the corner), this was not a problem. The rooms are located on the 4th floor of an apartment building in Trastevere. From Fiumicino airport, take the local (NOT the express) to Trastevere station, and then take the #8 tram to a stop near the hotel. The door to the building is not well marked, so look at Google Maps to be sure you know what it looks like. I had no problem finding the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Place for a seeing Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gumbo J
Reviews.Content: This is a great little place. It is a converted apartment flat so things are a little different from a normal Hotel. A lot of reviewers were complaining about the noise, but room 1 was silent. I didn't hear a thing through the windows. The bed and towels were very clean as well. The rooms them selves were a little spartan but honestly i wasn't expecting a lavish room. It's exactly what you need for exploring Rome and not staying in your room the entire time. The bed and pillows were very firm, but that's about the same all over Italy from what I gathered from other reviews. The Hotel does have Wi-Fi and I never had an issue with it. A good solid signal with good speeds. There was a TV, but honestly i think i flipped it on once. The location... that's the kicker. This place is great! you literally have a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum and a 15 minute walk to the Vatican. It's very centrally located and you can't get lost going home. You just find the Tibber river and head down river until you hit Ponte Geribaldi and head down the Viale Trastevere. After a long day of walking there are plenty of good restaurants around the hotel as well. I found a place called Da Vittiro, good service, great food and it wasn't crawling with people either. Check out Santa Maria in Trastevere while you're over there. It was my favorite church out of all of Rome. The hotel staff (Sairis (sorry if I misspelled your name)) is very helpful and good to talk to. He ends up coming in at all hours to check people in as they arrive at the hotel. He speaks Indian, English and Italian and maybe another but I can't remember off the top of my head. The stairs up to the hotel aren't bad, just make sure you count out the right number of floors and dont try going into the door a level down... I definitely didnt do that. There is a small elevator to take you up and down if you have luggage too. I would defiantly stay here again when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: debbyspero
Reviews.Content: we wanted to be near the Great Synagogue in the old Jewish Ghetto in rome. this was a 10 min walk from there, in the wonderful trastevere neighborhood. these are suites, not a hotel. the staff was extremely nice, our room (#7) was gorgeous and very large. the bed was very comfortable. we have only the nicest things to say. would def stay there again and would def recommend it to others looking to stay in that part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay, friendly, clean”
Reviews.Author: businessmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our large family, and got two rooms that we could walk in between without going into the public area. The staff was friendly. The place doesn't have a sign outside, but thanks to the TripAdvisor information we were prepared. The rooms are high up, but still face a street with trams on it, so if you are a light sleeper, or have to keep the window open, you will hear it. We were ok with it. The place was very clean, the staff friendly, and value-for-money excellent. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Rome”
Reviews.Author: penguinVancouver
Reviews.Content: What a find! Because of the storms across europe over the Christmas holiday we had issue with our luggage and had to wait at the airport for it to arrive on the next flight. The hotel is run like a B&B and after hours your on your own. So upon landing we phoned the hotel and Tommaso waited late for us to finally arrive. We were staying 7 days and given a nice, large, street facing room which I thought would be a problem but it was very quiet. Everything was simple and perfect for our needs. We don't like to spend time in our hotels when traveling but they must be in a good central location and clean, which this was. Breakfast is at a little bar a few doors down from the hotel and had really good fresh, hot croissants and coffee which was perfect. The Trastevere neighborhood is pretty awesome as well. Great restaurants, cafes and night life. This hotel is perfectly situated in Trastevere and near all major sites like; Vatican, Pz Navona, Pz Campo de Fiori, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, all of central Rome. A short walk across the Ponte Gribaldi Bridge and you are walking distance to every main attraction. If you want comfortable, clean, value for the money accommodations in Rome, this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: ali_travelling
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin and ended up with a double, but the room was ok. Very very noisy with the trams going past but it is Rome afterall. We had friendly service but breakfast at the cafe was not friendly at all and was limited to coffee or juice and a pastry. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great hotel. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: noonanagain
Reviews.Content: This is in the perfect location. There is no real service but I wasn't expecting it because I read the reviews here. The hotel was very clean. I stayed in the triple room. The only complaint I have is the pillows. The worst pillow ever! Love the little cafe on the corner for cappuccino and croissants in the morning. I arrived in Rome alone and had the owner book me a car service...it was well worth it. The way home, just booked a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hippychick34
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic four day trip with family and friends to Rome. Having been to Rome before i would recommend Trastevere to anyone who is deciding which area to stay in. It has real character with lovely little cobbled streets and piazzas, and the bars and restaurants are much cheaper and nicer than the tourist rip-off places near Piazza Navona etc. The centre of Rome however is easily accessible either on foot or the tram stops just outside the hotel. The Vatican is about a twenty minute stroll along the river. I would certainly recommend Sonnino Suites. The rooms were spacious, with fridge, safe,tv,air-conditioning and hairdryer all provided. The bed was very comfortable indeed. Although our room over-looked the busy Viale Trastevere, the excellent double-glazing blocked out any noise. Sonnino Suites is a bed and breakfast, not a hotel so reception is not open 24hrs. However, the staff will email you to find out your expected arrival time and will be there to welcome you. You are given a ticket for each day's breakfast which is taken at the small cafe downstairs. The breakfast is assorted croissants, coffee and toast but we found it enough to start the day. The hotel is slightly difficult to find as it is on 4th floor of a large building and there is no sign on the outside door, but this is quite typical of Rome. I printed a picture off the web which made it much easier as i recognised it straight away. We found an excellent restaurant called Pontefino, in the square behind the hotel which offered a 10 euro menu. This included starter, main course, dessert and even a drink, excellent value for money and good food, Pancotto, across the road, was also very good. A word of warning, in central Rome, especially in the Piazza Navona, the price of a beer was an extortionate 9 euros.The best way to get to Trastevere from the airport is to take the local F1 train to Trastevere Station. Tickets are 8 euros and the journey takes about 25 mins. You then cross the carpark outside the station and get tram no 8 to Belli which is 6 stops and costs 1 euro. I can't wait to go back to Rome and will certainly stay at Sonnino Suites again

Reviews.Title: “Clean,friendly,spacious quad room, good location”
Reviews.Author: famfun2010
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time here. We loved the area and it was a central position to see main sights. Nice to walk home along the river. Staff friendly and helpful. Our luggage was lost at airport and staff sorted delivery back to our rooms. Lots of restaurants/cafes nearby. Our room was simple but clean and lots of room. Breakfast ( continental) is supplied by local cafe. We really enjoyed watching the morning activities as locals streamed in for their hit of caffeine. The guy in there a real character and our children were sad to say goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: RachSB
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay - the staff on the desk were really friendly and helpful (but if you needed something ie. remote/clock batteries had gone, they were not addressed!).....the rooms were fine (room 4 was lovely, room 2 was really nice and room 3 was fine). We paid 60 euros a night so it was excellent value, esp for Rome. We liked the independance of converted apartments so you felt like a local by the end! The towels are changed every couple of days, the rooms have fridges which is excellent, the windows are double glazed with black outs so you could sleep really well, the lift is small but a godsend and the breakfast at the cafe is fine - we always bought another pastry and coffee and that kept us going - they were only 80 cents each so cheap. The ambience and staff were also great and we often popped in after a days sightseeing for a drink. The location is fab - you can walk to everything and it's easy to find - so much nicer than the touristy areas of Spanish Steps, etc. We had some rubbish meals but found the Pancotto on viale Trastevere to be very good (come out of the hotel, turn left and cross the road - a few hundred metres down. I see it has been reviewed separately! If you are after a no frills place, then this is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this Hotel to those travelling to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Structures
Reviews.Content: Everyone has concerns when booking a hotel via the internet, especially when travelling with others. I would say that this hotel is one of the best B&B I have taken on chance. From the welcome by Tomasso to the cleanliness of the rooms and even the small cafe that you use for breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning on travelling to Rome. It has an ideal location with everything within walking distance. If you have problems walking however there is a brilliant local transport link outside the hotel. Trastavere itself is a rabbit warren of small streets and restaurants and safe and ideal to wander at night.

Reviews.Title: “No better value for money”
Reviews.Author: DavidTBeijing
Reviews.Content: We paid EUR 100 per night. Rather difficult to find - it's actually two converted apartments on the 4th floor of the building. They only have people at reception between certain hours so make sure to coordinate arrival time in advance. There are 10 rooms. Our party had rooms 5 and 7 which were fine, and also room 1 which was very small (it's the last one they give when the hotel is full). Spacious rooms, clean, well decorated. New bathroom. Aircon and heating. Excellent double glazing so you don't hear the traffic. Breakfast is a coffee and a croisant at the cafe below but for what we paid you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Emad_10
Reviews.Content: Everything was great about the whole stay. Location and Rates are the main reasons for choosing the Hotel. Staff was very efficient, although they are not there all the time. Cleanness level is excellent. It was Walking distance to almost all the attractions. The only downfall is the breakfast; it was only Coffee and Croissant. Something else, the Internet did not work all the time. But for sure, if I go to Rome again I will stay there. Emad Mikhaiel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice enough place”
Reviews.Author: Kathy189934
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Sonnino Suite was the location. Right in the middle of Trastevere near restaurants, river and walking distance to many sights. The room was spacious and clean, bed comfortable (room didn't quite look like on their website, but was ok anyway), bathroom was also clean, shower good. The man at the desk was very friendly. The breakfast was not great, a coupon to a cafe downstairs for a coffee and croisant. Nice enough place to stay, excellent location, no complaints. One thing that was strange though was that we did not get clean towels the second day. The shower was somehow leaking and we put the towels on the floor to dry the floor. Next day after the cleaning the same towels were hanging and drying in the bathroom and no new ones to replace them. Thus we had to dry ourselves with towels that had been soaking wet on the floor??

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, nice neighbourhood, friendly”
Reviews.Author: harney78
Reviews.Content: We got two brand new rooms for a good price. The rooms were spacious compared to many other rooms I have experienced in Rome and also clean. The breakfast consisted of coffe and a croissant at the bar next door. Some people in the company thought that was not really sufficient. The best thing with Sonnino Suite is definately the location - in vibrant Trastevere with restaurants, cafes and bars, close to the river and within walking distance to most major sights. Public transportation is also close by if you don't want to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not a B&B, so-so experience-look harder for a nicer place”
Reviews.Author: SarahCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sonnino Suites, following excellent directions from the train station from our host, Tommaso. When we arrived, the building is unnassuming- no sign, just a building number to let you know where you are. If you look, there is a very small bell to the left of the door and the name "Sonnino Suites" is on the bell, very small. We didnt see that, but entered the lobby because people were leaving, and asked some workmen where the suites were. They are on the 4th floor, there is a miniscule lift, but it is a lift so be happy. As with so many places we have stayed in Europe (we are on a 3 week family trip) there are plusses and minuses to every location at which we have stayed. Here are the plusses of Sonnino Suites: Right on a very main artery-plenty of transportation within 2 minute walk; A tourist infor booth right across the street and tabachi to buy tickets; near nice restaurants and some sights (go to Pancotto across the street-very good food, reasonable prices, friendly people). The rooms, being on the 4th floor, are quiet and have good AC and good sound proof windows, OK view. The beds are comfortable, the bathrooms very clean, showers very good, hot water good. Ammenities like soap and shampoo are provided. The minuses: there is basicaly no reception much time you will be here- meaning in the mornings before you leave for your destinations and in the evenings when you return. I never met Tomasso, with whom I corresponded. I met his desk guy, Sayles I think his name is, who is here from maybe 9-10 & 2-4 some times. On the room door it says reception is here 8-10, then 14:30-19:30. Its not. The building is fairly unnoccupied- there is a dentist office on the first floor, Ive never seen anyone else except a couple of other travellers entering the other suites on this floor. This is most definately NOT a B&B- there is no breakfast, no coffee, nothing but beds. The TV didnt work. There is a fridge in the room, so you can go to the local market (left out the door about 2 blocks and across the street) and get some very nice things to eat. But you still wont be able to make your own coffee unless you brought an electric appliance to do that. When you check in you will be asked to pay in full up front, unlike many places that let you settle the bill on your way out. If I hadnt done this I would have looked for other lodgings with more ammenities for the same price- I am sure we could have found something that offered more, but I'm also sure that that is why they have you pay up front. Oh, and PS, I cant load pictures until we get back to the States, but the room looks nothing like the small photo on the TA website. The furnishings are an odd combination of dorm room press board desk, headboard and closets with a couple of antique elements like church kneelers and an old mirror thrown in for a weird amalgam of styles. The effect is neither quaint or "funky", just kind of cheap and thrown together.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: er22
Reviews.Content: Sonnino Suite is in a great location--right in the middle of Trastevere. It is convenient to all of the nice restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. It is also an easy walk to the major sites. The Tiber is one block away and is nice to walk along as well. The room was comfortable and the price was right. The rate even included a breakfast of a coffee and croissant at the cafe on the first floor. The manager was friendly and helpful. Trastevere is a great place to stay--a very vibrant area.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I wanted!”
Reviews.Author: zannelapl
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay at SONNINO SUITES.Very clean,linens changed, as was said, every three days and room provided everything the site was describing.I had a single room,small and cozy,with double bed.The man at the reception was very friendly and the breakfast was simple,but very tastefull (the best capuccino!).The area was perfect,lively,with restaurants,caffes and the tourist kiosk just across the street.Also very good soundproof windows.I would definatelly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trastevere find”
Reviews.Author: jgytraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a small, 5-room hotel on the fourth floor (elevator) of a nice building. The location is fantastic, right next to one of Trastevere's main streets, with restaurants and shops. Rome is a walkable city, and being in Trastevere puts you within 20 minutes of walking to most of the famous places, or transit is readily available in the area. There is a front desk person most of the day. He is very helpful and knows a lot about the area. The rooms are very well decorated, with a flat screen TV, free internet, and a mini fridge. The hardwood floors and pendant chandeliers really give it a nice touch, especially for a "2 star" hotel. Even though the building faces a busy street, the windows are amazingly strong and it is very quiet. Really great location, rooms, and service for 100 euro a night. Highly recommended for a great Rome stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property!”
Reviews.Author: BellaSerpente
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at this property was wonderful! The room itself was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. The proprietor is very accommodating, and the gentleman at the front desk was so friendly and helpful. The neighborhood is safe and there are many activities within walking distance. Public transport is also easily accessible. The complimentary breakfast is a coupon for the bar downstairs, and the pastries and beverages were delicious. The bar staff is also very friendly. We will definitely recommend this property to our family and friends visiting Rome, and will certainly stay here when we return.

HotelInfo.Name: Sonnino Suite B&B
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza Sidney Sonnino 25, 00153 Rome, Italy
